product_name: FalconGuides The Kids' Outdoor Adventure Book: 448 things to Do in Nature Before You Grow Up
long_description: . Authors: Stacy Tornio and Ken Keffer. Softcover; 205 pages; color illustrations. Morris Book Publishing, LLC; copyright 2012. Activities are divided by season, and each season features a series of fun and simple tasks that get kids outside and engaged in nature. Examples include running barefoot on the beach, catching a frog or toad, listening to a waterfall, looking closely at a spider web or finding your state flower. Also includes suggested games like Duck, Duck, Goose, suggested projects such as building a birdhouse or making rock art, and simple recipes such as soups or apple crisp.
short_description: The Kids' Outdoor Adventure Book is a year-round activity guide for getting kids outside to explore and have fun in the natural world.
